intro: Pentacalia vernicifolia, commonly known as the glossy pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has succulent, waxy leaves that help it retain moisture in its arid native habitat. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
